sentences.english: Who says breakfast has to be boring?
sentences.chinese: 谁说早餐一定是乏味无趣的呢？

sentences.english: Very uninterest hesitate life and mentally stupefied are following me.
sentences.chinese: 生活很无趣彷徨和迷茫伴随着我。

sentences.english: A group of uninteresting people fishing fishing profits vampire son of the SA.
sentences.chinese: 一群无趣的捞名捞利的吸血的瘙子。

sentences.english: I'm boring, I'm moody, you can't take me any place.
sentences.chinese: 我很无趣，喜怒无常，你甩不掉我。

sentences.english: A good te acher knows how to turn a boring lesson into a fun activity.
sentences.chinese: 好老师知道如何将一堂无趣的课变成一场有趣的活动。

sentences.english: What then is the idea of vapid and obligation-free body baring?
sentences.chinese: 那么，无趣而无偿的裸露，又有什么意思呢？

sentences.english: Dull and juiceless as only book knowledge can be when it is unrelated to…life.
sentences.chinese: 书本知识如果脱离生活则是干瘪的和无趣的。

sentences.english: The congregation was bored by the sermon.
sentences.chinese: 群众对布道感到烦闷无趣。

sentences.english: The book was padded out with uninteresting descriptions.
sentences.chinese: 这本书用些无趣的描写拉得太长。

sentences.english: Something that is too abstract and theoretical can be a bit tedious to listen to for too long.
sentences.chinese: 太抽象和太理论化的冗长演讲，都会显得乏味无趣。

sentences.english: “Life is short, dull, full of pain, ” he says.
sentences.chinese: “生命短暂又无趣，而且充满苦痛，”他说。

sentences.english: You will be transformed from the starkness of modern life into the middle ages.
sentences.chinese: 你将会被从现代生活的无趣转变到中世纪。

sentences.english: Some of the EU’s regular summits with China are very dull.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟和中国之间的一些定期峰会非常无趣。

sentences.english: That one simply finds you boring.
sentences.chinese: 那只说明他觉得你很无趣。

sentences.english: Monday meeting is the most wearisome part of my job.
sentences.chinese: 周一的会议是我工作中最冗长又无趣之处。

definition: to lose all interest in life (idiom)
bored/fed up with sth/sick of sth
bored/to be fed up with/sick and tired of sth
to have no strength/to feel weak/exhausted/feeling listless/boring/of no interest
to be weary of/to be fed up with/tedious
